title: What is AI?
content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) refers to systems or machines that mimic human intelligence.
AI can improve decision-making, perform tasks efficiently, and learn from data.
notes: Speaker Note: Mention examples like image recognition and voice assistants.

title: History of AI
content: AI research began in the 1950s.
The term 'Artificial Intelligence' was coined at the Dartmouth Conference in 1956.
notes: Speaker Note: Emphasize the evolution from symbolic AI to machine learning.

title: Machine Learning
content: A subset of AI that learns patterns from data.
Includes supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.
notes: Speaker Note: Provide real-world ML examples (recommendation systems, spam filters).

title: Deep Learning
content: Uses neural networks with multiple layers to learn complex patterns.
Fueled by large datasets and powerful GPUs.
notes: Speaker Note: Mention popular frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.

title: Natural Language Processing
content: Focuses on the interaction between computers and human language.
Includes tasks like sentiment analysis, translation, and chatbots.
notes: Speaker Note: Point out recent advances like transformer-based models (e.g., GPT).

title: Computer Vision
content: Enables machines to interpret and understand visual data.
Used in facial recognition, self-driving cars, and more.
notes: Speaker Note: Mention how deep learning revolutionized image classification.

title: Robotics and AI
content: Combining robotics with AI for perception, decision-making, and actions.
Examples: factory automation, robotic surgery, and drones.
notes: Speaker Note: Mention ethical considerations with autonomous systems.

title: AI Ethics
content: Involves fairness, transparency, and accountability in AI systems.
Focus on responsible usage to avoid bias or misuse.
notes: Speaker Note: Highlight guidelines from organizations like IEEE and the EU Commission.

title: Current Trends
content: AI-driven tools for healthcare, finance, and education.
Generative AI for creating text, images, and more.
notes: Speaker Note: Cite recent success stories and breakthroughs.

title: Future of AI
content: Continued growth in automation and cognitive computing.
Potential for AGI (Artificial General Intelligence) remains debated.
notes: Speaker Note: Encourage open discussion on the societal impact of advanced AI.
